intro: Taeniophyllum arunachalense, commonly known as the Arunachal buttonviolet, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories at high altitudes. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are short and compact. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
